Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for storage capacity, performance, and latency. Identify the applications and workloads that will use Azure HPC Cache.
Design the cache architecture, including the placement of cache clusters, integration with existing storage systems, and network topology.
Choose the appropriate cache tier and configuration based on workload requirements and budget constraints.
Create and configure the Azure HPC Cache instance in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell.
Connect the HPC Cache to the required storage systems, such as Azure Blob Storage or on-premises NAS systems.
Enable required security measures, such as encryption for data in transit and at rest. Configure access control policies and ensure compliance with organizational security standards.
Perform thorough testing of the cache performance, including throughput, latency, and failover scenarios to ensure it meets the required specifications.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and other tools. Configure alerts for cache performance, capacity thresholds, and error conditions.
Document the cache architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the setup.
Ensure the cache setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of the HPC Cache service. Identify and resolve any anomalies or issues promptly.
Regularly review and validate the HPC Cache configuration to ensure it aligns with storage requirements and best practices.
Conduct security audits to ensure the HPC Cache service complies with organizational security policies and standards. Verify encryption settings and access controls.
Regularly back up cache metadata to ensure data integrity and availability in case of service disruptions.
Analyze performance metrics and optimize cache settings to ensure efficient storage operations and minimal latency.
Conduct failover tests to verify the resiliency of the HPC Cache service and ensure that backup systems function correctly during outages.
Apply updates and patches to the HPC Cache software to ensure the service remains secure and up-to-date with the latest features.
Review access logs to detect unauthorized access or unusual activity within the HPC Cache service.
Ensure all operational procedures, configurations, and troubleshooting guides for HPC Cache are up-to-date and accessible.
Evaluate the HPC Cache service against its SLA to ensure compliance and address any deviations.
Perform incident response drills to prepare the team for potential service disruptions or security incidents.
Provide training to the operations team to stay updated with new HPC Cache features and best practices.
Develop and execute plans for expanding HPC Cache capacity as storage demands grow.
